Notion.description: Used for organizing pages, databases, and project management in a structured way.

Figma.description: Used for creating visual elements, mockups, and UI/UX design for projects like Green Hub.

Canva.description: Used for designing marketing materials like flyers and business cards.

Adobe Photoshop.description: Used for advanced image editing, graphic design, and digital art creation.

Adobe Illustrator.description: Used for vector graphics, logo design, and illustrations.

Adobe InDesign.description: Used for creating layout designs, particularly for print media such as brochures and magazines.

Adobe Firefly.description: Used for creative generative AI tasks such as enhancing images or creating visual content.

DALL-E.description: Used for creative generative AI tasks such as enhancing images or logotypes.

WordPress (OVH).description: Used for managing client websites and personal projects, hosted on OVH. Ensures content management and seamless website operations.

Google Docs.description: Used for collaborative documents, tables, and organizing commercial team strategies.

Google Sheets.description: Used for data management, tracking, and collaborative spreadsheet work.

Google Slide.description: Used for creating presentations, particularly for project pitches and educational content.

GitHub.description: Used for managing scripts, Python files, and MyGPT configuration.

Buffer.description: Used for scheduling and automating social media posts across various platforms.

Calendly.description: Used for scheduling meetings and organizing time slots, simplifying event booking processes.

MyGPTs.description: Used for configuring personalized AI bots to help automate content creation and project workflows.

Google Calendar.description: Used for organizing and scheduling meetings, tasks, and personal events.

Apple Calendrier.description: Used for personal event scheduling and syncing with other Apple devices for time management.

Canary Mail.description: Used for email communication and integration of events into calendars for efficient scheduling.

Instagram.description: Main platform for visual content and engaging with creative communities. Used for marketing projects and personal artistic work.

LinkedIn.description: Used for professional networking and sharing insights related to entrepreneurial projects and thought leadership.

Facebook.description: Rarely used, mainly for keeping in touch with personal and professional connections.

Twitter/X.description: Used for sharing thoughts, news, and engaging in discussions on industry topics.

Spotify for Podcasters.description: Used for publishing and managing podcasts, primarily for audio content creation and distribution.

Bento.me.description: Used for maintaining a small personal creative feed, focusing on sharing insights and artistic content.

SemRush.description: Used for SEO optimization, keyword research, and monitoring competitors' online presence.

SimilarWeb.description: Used for tracking website traffic and analyzing digital performance metrics.

Google Meet.description: Used for video conferencing, virtual meetings, and remote collaboration with teams and clients.

Whereby.description: Used for conducting video meetings, particularly for team or client collaboration.

OBS Studio.description: Used for live streaming and recording video content for webinars, tutorials, and presentations.
